intro: Lindsaea alpestris, commonly known as the alpine lindsaea, is a species of fern that belongs to the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. This plant is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves that form a rosette structure, which helps it retain moisture in its arid environment. Lindsaea alpestris typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats where it can receive ample sunlight. Its reproductive structures, known as spores, are produced on the underside of its leaves, contributing to its unique botanical features.
